creator: bwilson@foundation.sdsu.edu
text:
httpd: Syntax error on line 144 of /usr/local/apache-2.4.10/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load modules/mod_dir.so into server: /usr/local/apache-2.4.10/modules/mod_dir.so: undefined symbol: apr_array_clear

The above error occurs when I enter apachectl start. 

I have installed the latest version of apr-1.5.1 that I can find. I have installed it just about everywhere that I can think to install it. I can install it somewhere else if necessary. I just want to know where mod_dir.so expects to find it.

I'm trying to upgrade from apache-2.4.6 to apache-2.4.10. I did not encounter this problem with 2.4.6.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
(probably for users@httpd.apache.org mailing list)

What was your configure invocation (config.nice in your build tree)?

What does "ldd /usr/local/apache-2.4.10/bin/httpd" output?

Where did you install apr 1.5.1?

--/--

If you first build apr 1.5.1 with prefix --prefix=/usr/local/apache-2.4.10 then build apr 1.5.latest with same prefix and --with-apr=/usr/local/apache-2.4.10 then build httpd with same prefix and pointing there for apr and apr-util, you shouldn't have a problem.

creator: bwilson@foundation.sdsu.edu
text:
(In reply to Jeff Trawick from comment #1)
> (probably for users@httpd.apache.org mailing list)
> 
> What was your configure invocation (config.nice in your build tree)?
> 
> What does "ldd /usr/local/apache-2.4.10/bin/httpd" output?
> 
> Where did you install apr 1.5.1?
> 
> --/--
> 
> If you first build apr 1.5.1 with prefix --prefix=/usr/local/apache-2.4.10
> then build apr 1.5.latest with same prefix and
> --with-apr=/usr/local/apache-2.4.10 then build httpd with same prefix and
> pointing there for apr and apr-util, you shouldn't have a problem.

That works. Thank you very much!

glad you got it going

marking this as invalid instead of fixed since nothing needed to change in httpd
creator: trawick@apache.org
